required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioavailability of Fish Oils: Emulsified Versus Capsular Triglyceride
clinical_study.official_title: Bioavailability of Fish Oils: Emulsified vs. Capsular Triglyceride

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of this investigation is to determine the relative percentage and rate of incorporation of eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) and total omega-3 (n-3) fatty acids after ingestion of 4 emulsified flavored triglyceride fish oil supplements versus an encapsulated triglyceride in defined plasma lipid pools.
The primary endpoints to be evaluated include the fatty acid composition of plasma lipids before and after consumption of a single dose of emulsified triglyceride based fish oil and triglyceride of similar n-3 compositions in capsule form. The investigators will measure changes in plasma phospholipid, and chylomicron fatty acids.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve for phospholipid fatty acids
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the bioavailability of fatty acids from fish oil supplements

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve for chylomicron fatty acids
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the bioavailability of fatty acids from fish oil supplements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Healthy adults ages 18 to 60.
2. Body mass index between 22 and 32 kg/m2.
3. Medical history (interview) demonstrating good health.
4. Nonsmoker.
5. Consumption of a typical American diet with no unusual dietary habits.
6. Willingness to comply with the study protocol.
7. Low reported n-3 intake (<100 mg/d) on the Omega-3 Checklist
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any active, uncontrolled medical problem.
2. Consumption of essential fatty acid supplements within the past 6 months.
3. Use of lipid lowering drugs.
4. Fish consumption greater than 1 fish meal per week

reference.citation: Raatz SK, Redmon JB, Wimmergren N, Donadio JV, Bibus DM. Enhanced absorption of n-3 fatty acids from emulsified compared with encapsulated fish oil. J Am Diet Assoc. 2009 Jun;109(6):1076-81. doi: 10.1016/j.jada.2009.03.006.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.keyword: Bioavailability fo fish oil supplements in healthy adults
